Journal.Title: Environmental science and pollution research international

Article.ArticleTitle: Computational study of H-abstraction reactions from CH<sub>3</sub>OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl/CH<sub>3</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl by Cl atom and OH radical and fate of alkoxy radicals.

AbstractText: Multichannel gas-phase reactions of CH<sub>3</sub>OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl/CH<sub>3</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl with chlorine atom and hydroxyl radical have been investigated using ab initio method and canonical variational transition-state dynamic computations with the small-curvature tunneling correction. Further energetic information is refined by the coupled-cluster calculations with single and double excitations (CCSD)(T) method. Both hydrogen abstraction and displacement processes are carried out at the same level. Our results reveal that H-abstraction from the -OCH<sub>2</sub>- group is the dominant channel for CH<sub>3</sub>OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl by OH radical or Cl atom, and from α-CH<sub>2</sub> of the group CH<sub>3</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>- is predominate for the reaction CH<sub>3</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl with Cl/OH. The contribution of displacement processes may be unimportant due to the high barriers. The values of the calculated rate constants reproduce remarkably well the available experiment data. Standard enthalpies of formation for reactants and product radicals are calculated by isodesmic reactions. The Arrhenius expressions are given within 220-1200 K. The atmospheric lifetime, ozone depleting potential (ODP), ozone formation potential (OFP), and global warming potential (GWP) of CH<sub>3</sub>OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl/CH<sub>3</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl are investigated. Meanwhile, the atmospheric fate of the alkoxy radicals are also researched using the same level of theory. To shed light on the atmospheric degradation, a mechanistic study is obtained, which indicates that reaction with O<sub>2</sub> is the dominant path for the decomposition of CH<sub>3</sub>OCH(O•)CH<sub>2</sub>Cl, the C-C bond scission reaction is the primary reaction path in the consumption of CH<sub>3</sub>CH(O•)OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl in the atmosphere.

Ab initio method and canonical variational transition-state theory are employed to study the kinetic nature of hydrogen abstraction reactions of CH<sub>3</sub>OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl/CH<sub>3</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl with Cl atom and OH radical and fate of alkoxy radicals (CH<sub>3</sub>OCH(O•)CH<sub>2</sub>Cl/CH<sub>3</sub>CH(O•)OCH<sub>2</sub>CH<sub>2</sub>Cl).
